meanings.definition: The office or position of a vicar.
meanings.sent1: In the small town, the vicarships were highly respected by the community.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to hold one of the vicarships at the local church.
meanings.sent3: The vicarships in the village were always busy with various church duties.
meanings.sent4: The vicarships stood as pillars of guidance in the parish.
meanings.sent5: The vicarships oversaw the spiritual well-being of the congregation.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a vicar.
meanings.sent1: During his vicarship, the church saw significant growth.
meanings.sent2: The vicarship of Reverend Smith lasted for ten years.
meanings.sent3: The vicarship of the new vicar brought a sense of renewal to the parish.
meanings.sent4: The vicarship passed from one generation to the next with grace.
meanings.sent5: The vicarship marked a period of stability and progress for the church.
